7.14.17  12:27 am   Basing this off the answer to the 7.13.17 2:45 pm question: What's wrong with a mish mash of visions/ideas? Sure it wouldn't be the same as before but that doesn't mean it's worse. It could even be better than you think. Like how you said your audience doesn't know what they like until you give it to them. Maybe someone could give you an idea that wows you and makes the video a lot more interesting.

7.13.17  9:40 pm   how would you call that section in "got to know what's going on" right before the last choruses? the bit that goes "open the door, cuz i got to know what we came here for, whatever it is i'll believe it". it doesn't "feel" like part of the bridge since it imitates the verse, chorus and prechorus sections. my best guess would be to call it a "summary" but that's not a musical term afaik

7.13.17  2:45 pm   So the paradox is, you need help in order to do all this crazy stuff quickly. But if major parts of it (the music, the visuals, the writing) aren't done by you then it's not Bill Wurtz Content anymore. Then it's a mish mash of your vision and some stranger's interpretation of your vision. So you can't have any major help, but it'd be super helpful to have major help, am I getting that right?
